member.summary: Gets the file extension that will be used for the status files that are created for processed files.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.WebJobs.Extensions.Files.FileProcessor.MaxDegreeOfParallelism
member.summary: Gets the maximum degree of parallelism that will be used when processing files concurrently.
member.remarks: Files are added to an internal processing queue as file events are detected, and they're processed in parallel based on this setting.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.WebJobs.Extensions.Files.FileProcessor.MaxQueueSize
member.summary: Gets the bounds on the maximum number of files that can be queued up for processing at one time. When set to -1, the work queue is unbounded.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.WebJobs.Extensions.Files.FileProcessor.MaxProcessCount
member.summary: Gets the maximum number of times file processing will be attempted for a file.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.WebJobs.Extensions.Files.FileProcessor.InstanceId
member.summary: Gets the current role instance ID. In Azure WebApps, this will be the WEBSITE_INSTANCE_ID. In non Azure scenarios, this will default to the Process ID.

member.returns: A that returns true if the file was processed successfully, false otherwise.

member.returns: A representing the delay interval that should be used.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Azure.WebJobs.Extensions.Timers.TimersOptions
member.summary: Options object for decorated job functions. Currently this type is just a placeholder and presents no configurable options.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.WebJobs.Extensions.Timers.Listeners.TimerListener.StartupInvocation
member.summary: When set, we have a startup invocation that needs to happen immediately.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Azure.WebJobs.Extensions.Timers.Listeners.TimerListener.InvokeJobFunction(System.DateTime,System.Boolean,System.Boolean,System.Nullable{System.DateTime})
member.summary: Invokes the job function.
member.param: The time of the invocation, likely DateTime.Now.
True if the invocation is because the invocation is due to a past due timer.
True if the invocation is because the timer is configured to run on startup.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Azure.WebJobs.Extensions.Timers.Listeners.TimerListener.GetNextTimerInterval(System.DateTime,System.DateTime,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Calculate the next timer interval based on the current (Local) time.
member.remarks: We calculate based on the current time because we don't know how long the previous function invocation took. Example: if you have an hourly timer invoked at 12:00 and the invocation takes 1 minute, we want to calculate the interval for the next timer using 12:01 rather than at 12:00. Otherwise, you'd start a 1-hour timer at 12:01 when we really want it to be a 59-minute timer.
member.param: The next schedule occurrence in Local time.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Azure.WebJobs.Extensions.Timers.Listeners.TimerListener.StartupInvocationContext
member.summary: Provides context for an immediate startup time job invocation.
member.remarks: We must avoid invoking the job function from the listener start method because that can delay host startup and cause problems. Instead we invoke the function in the background by scheduling an immediate invocation.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Azure.WebJobs.Extensions.Timers.ConstantSchedule

member.name: T:Microsoft.Azure.WebJobs.Extensions.Timers.CronSchedule

member.summary: Constructs a new instance based on the specified crontab schedule.

member.summary: Constructs an instance based on the specified collection of instances.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Azure.WebJobs.Extensions.Timers.FileSystemScheduleMonitor
member.summary: This class is used to monitor and record schedule occurrences. It stores schedule occurrence info to the file system at runtime. uses this class to monitor schedules to avoid missing scheduled executions.

member.summary: Constructs a new instance

member.name: M:Microsoft.Azure.WebJobs.Extensions.Timers.FileSystemScheduleMonitor.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: Constructs a new instance

member.summary: Gets or sets the path where schedule status files will be written.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Azure.WebJobs.Extensions.Timers.FileSystemScheduleMonitor.GetStatusFileName(System.String)
member.summary: Returns the schedule status file name for the specified timer

member.name: T:Microsoft.Azure.WebJobs.Extensions.Timers.ScheduleMonitor
member.summary: This class is used to monitor and record schedule occurrences. It stores schedule occurrence info to persistent storage at runtime. uses this class to monitor schedules to avoid missing scheduled executions.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Azure.WebJobs.Extensions.Timers.ScheduleMonitor.GetStatusAsync(System.String)
member.summary: Gets the last recorded schedule status for the specified timer. If the timer has not ran yet, null will be returned.
member.param: The name of the timer to check.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Azure.WebJobs.Extensions.Timers.ScheduleMonitor.UpdateStatusAsync(System.String,Microsoft.Azure.WebJobs.Extensions.Timers.ScheduleStatus)
member.summary: Updates the schedule status for the specified timer.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Azure.WebJobs.Extensions.Timers.ScheduleMonitor.CheckPastDueAsync(System.String,System.DateTime,Microsoft.Azure.WebJobs.Extensions.Timers.TimerSchedule,Microsoft.Azure.WebJobs.Extensions.Timers.ScheduleStatus)
member.summary: Checks whether the schedule is currently past due.
member.remarks: On startup, all schedules are checked to see if they are past due. Any timers that are past due will be executed immediately by default. Subclasses can change this behavior by inspecting the current time and schedule to determine whether it should be considered past due.
member.param: The name of the timer to check.
The last recorded status, or null if the status has never been recorded.
member.returns: A non-zero if the schedule is past due, otherwise .

member.name: T:Microsoft.Azure.WebJobs.Extensions.Timers.ScheduleStatus
member.summary: Represents a timer schedule status. The scheduler uses this information to calculate function invocation times.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.WebJobs.Extensions.Timers.ScheduleStatus.Last
member.summary: Gets or sets the last recorded schedule occurrence.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.WebJobs.Extensions.Timers.ScheduleStatus.Next
member.summary: Gets or sets the expected next schedule occurrence.
member.remarks: When a function is invoked by the scheduler, the value of this property will effectively be the current time. To determine the next schedule occurrence from the current invocation, can be used.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.WebJobs.Extensions.Timers.ScheduleStatus.LastUpdated
member.summary: Gets or sets the last time this record was updated. This is used to re-calculate Next with the current Schedule after a host restart.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Azure.WebJobs.Extensions.Timers.TimerSchedule
member.summary: A timer scheduling strategy used with for schedule based triggered jobs.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.WebJobs.Extensions.Timers.TimerSchedule.AdjustForDST
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether intervals between invocations should account for DST.

member.summary: Gets the next occurrence of the schedule based on the specified base time.
member.param: The time to compute the next schedule occurrence from.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Azure.WebJobs.Extensions.Timers.TimerSchedule.GetNextOccurrences(System.Int32,System.Nullable{System.DateTime})
member.summary: Returns a collection of the next 'count' occurrences of the schedule, starting from now.
member.param: The number of occurrences to return.
member.returns: A collection of the next occurrences.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Azure.WebJobs.Extensions.Timers.TimerSchedule.ShouldDisableScheduleMonitor(Microsoft.Azure.WebJobs.Extensions.Timers.CronSchedule,System.DateTime)
member.summary: For schedules with an occurrence more frequent than 1 minute, we disable schedule monitoring.
member.returns: True if monitoring should be disabled, false otherwise.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Azure.WebJobs.TimerTriggerAttribute
member.summary: Attribute used to mark a job function that should be invoked periodically based on a timer schedule. The trigger parameter type must be .

member.name: M:Microsoft.Azure.WebJobs.TimerTriggerAttribute.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: Constructs a new instance based on the schedule expression passed in.
member.param: A schedule expression. This can either be a 6 field crontab expression or a string (e.g. "00:30:00"). On Azure Functions, a TimeSpan string is only supported when running on an App Service Plan.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Azure.WebJobs.TimerTriggerAttribute.#ctor(System.Type)
member.summary: Constructs a new instance using the specified type.
member.param: The type of schedule to use.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.WebJobs.TimerTriggerAttribute.ScheduleExpression
member.summary: Gets the schedule expression.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.WebJobs.TimerTriggerAttribute.ScheduleType
member.summary: Gets the type.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.WebJobs.TimerTriggerAttribute.UseMonitor
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the schedule should be monitored. Schedule monitoring persists schedule occurrences to aid in ensuring the schedule is maintained correctly even when roles restart. If not set explicitly, this will default to true for schedules that have a recurrence interval greater than 1 minute (i.e., for schedules that occur more than once per minute, persistence will be disabled).

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.WebJobs.TimerTriggerAttribute.RunOnStartup
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the function should be invoked immediately on startup. After the initial startup run, the function will be run on schedule thereafter.
